New Records: Afghanistan scored 183 runs in 20 overs, their highest score in the match.
Fazalhaq Farooqi took 3 wickets, contributing to Afghanistan's victory.
Key Match Events: Uganda won the toss and elected to bowl first.
Afghanistan achieved a significant win in their World Cup debut with a 125-run margin.
Pre-Game Insights: Uganda's decision to bowl first was a strategic choice to contain Afghanistan's strong batting lineup.
Afghanistan's experienced lineup was expected to perform well in their World Cup debut.
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan's players expressed relief and joy at their first World Cup win.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment in their World Cup campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Guyana National Stadium.
Uganda's young team put up a valiant effort but struggled against Afghanistan's quality bowling.
Others: The match was completed with Afghanistan achieving a comprehensive win.
